discussion.p: 8.1 [path.generic] says: "The filename dot-dot is treated as a reference to the parent directory." So it must be specified what "/.." and "/../.." refer to.
Add a statement what the parent directory of the root directory is.
discussion.note: 2014-02-11 Issaquah: Implementation defined. See wiki notes for rationale. Beman to provide wording for review next meeting.

blockquote.p: The filename dot is treated as a reference to the current directory. The filename dot-dot is treated as a reference to the parent directory. [Note: The root-directory has no parent directory.— end note] Specific filenames may have special meanings for a particular operating system.
